Description:
Behold, a knight clad in armor, commanding the king's army with unvavering determination, his presence inspiring the rallied masses trailing in his wake while striking fear into the hearts of the enemy ranks! A heavy blow of his lance shatters the enemy's defence line, clearing a path for victory. Radiating with divine energy of righteousness and bearing the standard of his allegiance, the paladin fearlessly presses forward, to victory!
Paladins are the knights, the crusaders and the vigilantes who bear divine magic through conviction and purpose, perhaps aided by their god, rather than mastery over the arcane. They are able to both heal, resist damage and fell enemies with holy retribution.
Be it by the sword, by the shield or by the book, paladins join (or form) an order or community of like-minded individuals, and follow their calling into battle - to attack, to protect, to serve for a greater future.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).
Proficiency Requirements: You have Skilled in Religion and have a number of extra non-combat Skills equal to your Intelligence.

~Skilled in Religion~.Effect: Add your Level to Checks for knowing about religions, praying, performing sermons, faith, etc.

Spellcasting.Spell Grade: 6 + Sense or Charisma, whichever is higher
Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells and Talents inbetween Adventures.
Spellcasting.Other: All Paladin-specific Abilities are considered Spells (unless stated otherwise).
Spellcasting.Recommended Abilities Description: As a Paladin, you must make use of your limited Spells as best as possible. Solace Wave is a solid heal, while Smite will come in handy when you wish to deal extra Damage. Asses Their Ranks is a decent survivability tool; hold it for when you are fighting multiple enemies. If you have no other options to do with a Half-Action, use Solace Wave in combination with Holy Grace in order to not waste resources on your turn!

~Vigor~.Effect: You start with 3 extra Max Health.

~Faith Casting~.Effect:
You do not use Mana.
Once per turn, you can cast a Warfare or Divine Ability you Know that costs Mana and you haven't already cast this Adventure, without spending Mana.
~Faith Casting~.Upgrade: If your Intelligence is 2 or higher, you can Know an additional Basic Ability.
~Faith Casting~.Notes:
For example, if you know Smite and Healing Word, you can cast each of them once this Adventure, without spending Mana.
Abilities must still respect their Cooldowns if any.

~Holy Grace~.Effect:
Deal 2 + ^Your Level^ Divine Damage to a Worthy Enemy.
Another ally you see is healed for all the Damage done.

~Divine Sense~.Effect: When you use this, for a brief moment, nearby holy and unholy presences emmit a subtle sound and smell ^only you can sense^.
~Divine Sense~.Upgrade: Unholiness smells sulphurous and sounds like a deep, echoing rumbling or breath. Holiness smells churchly and sounds like a reverbing crystaline ringing.
~Divine Sense~.Notes:
Walls block this smell and sound as they normally would.
This smell and sound can only be concealed with magic.

Starting Abilities Description.Faith Casting: Paladins are not true spellcasters and don't draw power from magical Mana, but rather from their conviction and courage on the battlefield. As such, you can fill your Known Abilities with powerful Ablities and you can use each of them once. This will get better as you Level up, allowing you to pick more options and even Spells that cost more than 1 Mana, which will be free for you! Pick wisely!

Starting Abilities Description.Holy Grace:
Use Holy Grace when you are in need of healing either yourself or an ally, or you need to dish out some quick, surefire Damage.
Since this takes a Half-Action, get a 1-Handed weapon to fill your turn with something to do after using Holy Grace (or get a Spell that takes a Half-Action).

Starting Abilities Description.Divine Sense: You have the power to detect foul creatures within range. Use this carefully only when you believe you need to, as it has a long cooldown.

Specializations.Description:
At Level 1, you can choose your oath (Specialization).
By choosing your oath, you dedicate yourself to a purpose; an oath is a lifestyle, not a mere choice!
Choices: Order of the Crusade, which inspires a strong personality and desire to achieve greatness by any means necessary
Order of the Tome, knowledgeable paladins dedicated to helping the unfortunate and being someone to look up to
Order of the Templar, an old sect chosen by those who vow to protect and wish to become a silent paragon of the people

~Crusade~.Effect: When ^YOU^ defeat one Worthy Enemy, all excess Damage is converted to healing or Divine Damage to a Unit within 5 meters of you.
~Crusade~.Notes: E.g. if a Unit has 5 Health and you deal 12 Damage, the Unit dies and you heal an ally (or yourself) for 7 Health using your Reaction, or blast another Unit for 7 Divine Damage. If you kill multiple Units at the same time, this triggers only for one of them.

~True Sense~.Effect: When you use this, for a brief moment, nearby ~presences with souls~ emmit a subtle sound and smell ^only you can sense^. ~One of them becomes Feared (randomly, or you can choose it if you see it)~.
~True Sense~.Upgrade: Unholiness smells sulphurous and sounds like a deep, echoing rumbling or breath. Holiness smells churchly and sounds like a reverbing crystaline ringing. Normal souls smell like clean mineral water and sound like a flowing waterfall.
~True Sense~.Notes:
Walls block this smell and sound as they normally would.
The smell and sound can be concealed with magic.

<Jihad>.Effect:
When healing yourself with Crusade, increase the healing by 50%.
Additionally, you can heal yourself with Holy Grace.

<Flaming Reach>.Effect:
Your weapon takes on a fiery aspect.
Your first melee attack every turn has up to 3 meters range, deals Fire Damage instead of Physical and deals 1d4 Fire Damage to the target and all Enemies within 2 meters of the target.
<Flaming Reach>.Upgrade: Passively, you can now cast Smite Abilities on ranged attacks.
<Flaming Reach>.Notes:
Attacks like this count as either melee or ranged attacks, your choice. Targets still benefit from Cover, regardless.
Alternatively, if it makes sense for your character, the DM might allow it to deal Cold, Scourge or Shock Damage instead of Fire. Talk to your DM about this.

<Join the Crusade>.Effect:
Ask a party member to join your cause and pledge their honor to you.
That person has the Crusade Ability and the same Tier 1 Talent you have.
It also has access to the Divine Ability List.
<Join the Crusade>.Notes:
Only one person can pledge for you and it must within sight or hearing to have access to all of those.
If you ever change this Talent, the ally loses access to all things mentioned; it regains them when you get this Talent again.

<Suspension of Belief>.Effect: While you have no Abilities that would cost Mana available to cast, your Paladin Abilities can be cast _Twice_ (e.g. Twice / Adventure, Twice / hour, Twice / Combat, etc).
<Suspension of Belief>.Notes:
You can achieve Suspension of Belief either by having no Known Abilities with a Mana cost, or having already cast all Abilities you Know that would cost Mana (via Faith Casting).
Be wary of your faith, though, for gods seldom hold a positive outlook on those putting their conviction on hiatus.

<Culling Smite>.Effect: After you roll for a melee attack, add 3d6 Divine Damage.
<Culling Smite>.Notes: Can not be used at the same time with other "Smite" Abilities.

<Lay on Hands>.Effect: Heal a Unit you can see for 50% of its Max Health.

<Personal Squire>.Effect:
You recruit a squire - a trusted NPC who gains combat powers. However, the capabilities of your squire are random: roll 1d4 to determine the type of your squire, based on the Squires category at Pets and Animals (1. Bold, 2. Sneaky, 3. Clever, 4. Wise). The Race is determined by the QM or by circumstance.
On its turn, it can do one Pet Attack, cast one Ability it has, or do the equivalent of a Half-Action (e.g. Sprint, Push).
You can recruit one squire per Adventure, but only one can follow you in your adventures at a time.
<Personal Squire>.Upgrade: If your squire drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your squire's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Personal Squire>.Notes: Your squire is not a Player Character by any means and does not behave like one (it can't use Weapons, Armor, Feats, Abilities, etc like a Player Character can). It is limited to what its stat block and Abilities say it can do. You can, however, give it orders, customize its looks (hair style, clothes, etc) and it will obey your commands within reason. You are the leader it looks up to. Lead proudly and fairly!

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Harrowing Judgement>.Effect:
Choose a Unit with 50% or less Health.
A colossal spectral lance hits it and ^crushes it to death^.
<Harrowing Judgement>.Upgrade: Against Epic monsters, the threshold is 15% or less Health instead.
<Harrowing Judgement>.Note:
You always know if a Unit would die from this (ask the QM).
The Unit dies.

~Crimson Grace~.Effect:
Deal 2 + ^Your Level^ Divine Damage to a Worthy Enemy.
An ally you see is healed for all the Damage done.
~Deals 50% extra Damage to Units affected by Crowd Control.~

<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Known Ability Bonus>.Effect: You can Know 1 extra Basic Ability.

<Aspect of Ascension>.Effect:
You burst with angelic wings and burning vim.
Until the end of your next turn, you have 50% extra Movement and can fly, and can cast unlimited Abilities that cost Mana, ignoring the Mana cost and the limits of Faith Casting.
<Aspect of Ascension>.Upgrade: You can't use the same Basic Ability twice on the same turn.
<Aspect of Ascension>.Notes: E.g. let's say you used Smite last turn. This turn you activate Aspect of Ascension. You make a 1-Handed weapon attack, and add Smite to it as well. Next turn, you cast Solace Wave and Hand of Freedom, then make anther attack to which you add Smite. Then, you end your turn and Aspect of Ascension ends. You can now still cast Solace Wave and Hand of Freedom once.

~Holy Tome~.Effect:
You have a special holy book you carry with you.
You can Know the same Ability multiple times.
You Know one extra Ability.
~Holy Tome~.Notes:
For example, if you can Know 3 Abilities, you can Know Smite, Solace Wave and Solace Wave. This means you can cast Solace Wave twice per Adventure. Or you could get Smite, Smite, Smite. Be creative!
You lose access to Innate Grace and your other Talents if you don't have the book somewhere at hand, such as hanging by your belt, in your hand or in your pocket. Should you lose the book, you can buy another one for 200 Gold at a respective temple.

~Innate Grace~.Effect: All your Divine Basic Spells have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.
~Innate Grace~.Notes:
{DiceUpgrade}
For example, Smite deals 1d8 Damage instead of 1d6, Lucent Wave heals for 1d10 (+1d10 if above 50% HP) instead of 1d8 (+1d8 if above 50% HP), etc.

<Golden Grace>.Effect:
Deal ~2 + Your Sense + Your Charisma~ Divine Damage to a Worthy Enemy.
An ally you see is healed for ~half~ of the Damage done.
<Golden Grace>.Upgrade: ~This has no Cooldown. You can heal yourself.~

<Assistance From Afar>.Effect: Use when an ally inflicts Crowd Control. That Crowd Control is transformed into a better effect.
<Assistance From Afar>.Upgrade:
^Slowed^ becomes ^Rooted^.
^Fumbling^ becomes ^Blinded^.
Any other harder Crowd Control becomes ^Stunned^.
<Assistance From Afar>.Notes: Hard Terrain is not Crowd Control. All Crowd Controls harder than Slowed, Fumbling, etc become Stunned.

<Devotion Aura>.Effect: All allies on your team have +1 Defense if their Defense is 0.

<White Knighthood>.Effect: While below 75% Health and wearing white clothes, all your Divine Basic Spells have their ^Dice^ further ^Upgraded^ to the next die type, on top of the upgrade from Divine Grace.

<Lay on Hands>.Effect: Heal a Unit you can see for 50% of its Max Health.

<Divine Blast>.Effect:
Deal 1d8 Damage for each Spell you cast this combat, all to a Unit.
You can apply Smites to this attack.

<Chrism Ritual>.Effect: Up to 3 party members gain Max Health (and Health) equal to their Health Regen.

<Life Echo>.Effect:
You put a Life Echo on another ally.
Whenever YOU heal a different Unit, the Unit with the Life Echo on them is also healed for 50% of that amount.

<Divine Resurgence>.Effect: All other Player Characters you healed this combat gain an extra Half-Action on their next turn.

<Asceticism>.Effect: For 1 minute, all Healing you do is increased by 50%, but all Damage you deal is reduced by 50%.

<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Known Ability Bonus>.Effect: You can Know 1 extra Basic Ability.

You burst with angelic wings and burning vim.
Until the end of your next turn, you have 50% extra Movement and can fly, and can cast unlimited Abilities that cost Mana, ignoring the Mana cost and the limits of Faith Casting.

<Aspect of Ascension>.Notes: E.g. let's say you used Smite last turn. This turn you activate Aspect of Ascension. You make a 1-Handed weapon attack, and add Smite to it as well. Next turn, you cast Solace Wave and Hand of Freedom, then make anther attack to which you add Smite. Then, you end your turn and Aspect of Ascension ends. You can now still cast Solace Wave and Hand of Freedom once.

<Echoing Self>.Effect: A spectral self appears at the position where you started your turn, and repeats all Acts you have already done this turn.
<Echoing Self>.Notes: The clone moves exactly as you did (can go through Units) and repeats the Spells and Attacks on the same targets. If there were any dice rolls, the clone rolls them (don't use the same numbers rolled). The clone is a separate special Unit - self effects apply to the clone (and thus self-heals have no effect).

~Blockade~.Effect:
When another ally is targeted and attacked (after the roll), dash to the closest space to that ally.
You take the Damage instead of the ally, and the Damage is reduced by 2.
~Blockade~.Notes: Acts as if the attack targeted you instead of the ally (apply your own Defense, Resistances, etc). Cover is stil applied as to the ally, though.

~Silver Grace~.Effect:
Deal 2 + ^Your Level^ Divine Damage to a Worthy Enemy.
An ally you see is healed for all the Damage done.
~Silver Grace~.Upgrade: ~If you are at or below 50% Health, increase the Damage by 50% and you can heal yourself.~

<Fellowship Aura>.Effect:
You stand out for allies near you.
Enemy ranged attacks against other allies within 1 meter of you have Cover.
<Fellowship Aura>.Notes: Nothing happens if an ally near you already has Cover. If playing on a grid, this does work for allies diagonally.

<Martyrdom>.Effect:
Use when an ally (or you) falls to 0 Health.
Immediately cast Silver Grace, ignoring its Cooldown.

<Knight in Black>.Effect:
You are Trained in all Weapons.
You are immune to being Slowed, Rooted and Feared.
While there are no allies within 4 meters of you, all your weapon attacks and self healing have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next dice type.
<Knight in Black>.Notes:
{DiceUpgrade}.
While _alone_, your healing Abilities have their Dice Upgraded when healing yourself.

<Man of Steel>.Effect: If you're wearing Heavy Armor or a Shield, you have +1 Defense and +5 Max Health.

<Broken Hearts>.Effect: All Damaged Enemies within 4 meters of you 2d4 + 1 True Damage and are Feared.
<Broken Hearts>.Notes: Cover is applied normally. Enemies with full Health are not affected.

The attack deals 1d6 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Warrior Spirits>.Effect:
Whenever you heal someone, summon a Warrior Spirit in any space near the target, with Health equal to the amount restored.
Warrior Spirits have and 4 Speed and can attack for 1d4 Divine Damage. They take their turn after yours.

<Avenging Blockade>.Effect:
When another ally is targeted and attacked (after the roll), dash to the closest space to that ally.
You take the Damage instead of the ally, and the Damage is reduced by 2, ~then you can immediately make an attack (freely) with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon on the attacker that deals only 50% Damage (if it's within 3 meters of you).~
<Avenging Blockade>.Notes: If the 1-Handed Weapon is not equipped, you quickly and freely equip it, attack, then switch back to your previous weapons.
